page.title: 18RESTENNETH MOSS
page.content: The area around Restenneth Priory is called Restenneth Moss. The{ecology consists of tall reeds and marsh. In some areas there are bushes, short grass and boggy ground. The most common bush around this area is the Sallow. All of the area around the Priory is an area of{conservation} designated as a Site of Special Scientific Interest. The moss has never been disturbed before although a local company wanted to drain water from the bogs but they were refused permission. In one area there are very{rare plants}which the owners are trying to preserve. Restenneth Priory was surrounded by a loch or Moss which acted like a{moat.}The loch was drained at the end of the 8th century by George Dempster, a well known local agriculturalist, for the marl which was used as fertiliser.
